intro: Cysticapnos, commonly known as the rock cress, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Brassicaceae. These plants are typically small, herbaceous, and often found growing in rocky or arid environments. They produce small, delicate flowers that are usually white or yellow in color. Cysticapnos species are characterized by their basal leaves and simple, unbranched stems. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in horticulture for their ornamental value.
